brief_summary.textblock:
Hypotension after spinal anesthesia for cesarean delivery occurs frequently. Oscillometric
      measurement gives intermittent informations. Nexfin, a continuous noninvasive device, could
      help to detect hypotension.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of NEXFIN During Cesarean Delivery to Detect Hypotension

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adult patients undergoing elective cesarean delivery performed under spinal
             anesthesia

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with a heart rhythm disorder, Raynaud's disease or a history of vascular
             surgery of the upper limb

intervention.other_name: Continuous measurement of arterial pressure using Nexfin

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the System NEXFIN for Continuous and Non-invasive Measure of the Blood Pressure During Cesarean Delivery Practised Under Spinal Anesthesia

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

primary_outcome.description: Bland and Altman analysis (bias and limits of agreement). Analysis concerns data from intrathecal injection to childbirth
primary_outcome.measure: Comparison between Nexfin and intermittent measurements of blood pressure

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis concerns data from intrathecal injection to childbirth
secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve between both measurements

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
